adjectives.description: capitulary (comparative more capitulary, superlative most capitulary)

entries.meaning: Of or related to a chapter, in its various senses.
Of or related to the Capitoulate of Toulouse.
examples: In mid-sixteenth century, the Conseil Général assembled almost eighty men and was, in fact, a remnant of the general assemblies held during the period of the medieval commune; but its functions were mostly limited to a ceremonial hearing of the municipal deliberations and the supervision of the capitulary election.

entries.meaning: A member of an ecclesiastical chapter
A set of decrees, especially those made by the Frankish kings
